intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. ovalicalyx, commonly known as the oval-leaved dotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually borne in dense, terminal inflorescences, and the species is noted for its delicate appearance. The botanical features of this plant make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
